result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam Garcia is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam Garcia was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharged from probation on 1/7/16
Discharge - Regular
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Defendant, Adam  Garcia, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Fel BJ:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions.  4 days sentence credit if revoked.  No restitution requested.  Court costs ordered.  DNA sample previously submitted.  $500 on deposit to be applied to costs.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Appeal rights given.

PER 2014 JUDICIAL ROTATION ORDER OF KENOSHA COUNTY

Defendant, Adam  Garcia, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Motion to dismiss withdraw by Atty Komp.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel BJ; found guilty by the court.  Ct 2 was dismissed outright.  PSI report ordered.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 10:30 am w/14CM456.
to Dismiss filed by Atty Angel Komp - 7/21/14 at 2:00 pm
A Komp

Defendant, Adam  Garcia, appeared with Attorney Charles C Bennett.  Attorney Jason R Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  14CF31 & 14CF442:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. has a new case, 14CF442, and asked that both cases be set over together for possible resolution.  Atty Bennett requests to withdraw as counsel due to his retirement in July.  Court grants Atty Bennett's request, new PD to be appointed.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Chuck Bennett. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Atty. Bennett renews his motion to dismiss ct. 2. Court denies motion. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-8-14 @ 2:00pm. Bond continued.

to Preliminary Hearing

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 5/8/14 @ 830 a.m.  Atty Bennett moves to dismiss Ct 2 - court denies motion.  $500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
